bug.author: wutaomsft
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h3>Description</denchmark-h>
The examples directory has a subdirectory called oj_retail. The name probably could be optimized to better reflect the use case we are trying to highlight. Are there keywords we want to cover in here? retail? grocery? perishable goods? I would not think OJ really signifies anything here. <denchmark-h:h3>How do we replicate the bug?</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-h:h3>Expected behavior (i.e. solution)</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-h:h3>Other Comments</denchmark-h>

comments.comment: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/wutaomsft>@wutaomsft</denchmark-link> Thanks for the comments. Currently we name each use case folder under directory after . OJ here represents Orange Juice dataset. We could remove oj and purely name the folder after the use case, e.g., grocery_sales or retail_sales. This may cause conflict when we want to add two datasets for a same use case. We will further discuss the naming of these folders and make necessary changes.
